p: The incubation period is about 1–2 d with a range of 1–4 d [ 7]. The viral shedding occurs from the day prior to symptoms and lasts for about 3–5 d in adults and for several weeks in young children and immunocompromised. The primary mode of transmission of the virus is by large size droplets. Particles <10 μm in diameter are more likely to cause infection in the lower respiratory tract.
